Thus far, the United States is the only nation with H5N1 in cows; it’s shown up in dairies in at least 17 states.

In all of known history, “This is the largest animal disease outbreak we’ve ever had,” says Maurice Pitesky, a veterinary researcher at the University of California, Davis.

The virus, which emerged nearly three decades ago, is now creating upheaval in the poultry and dairy industries and making economic and political waves due to the fluctuating price of eggs. But there’s more at risk here than grocery-store sticker shock. As it has journeyed around the world on the wings of migrating birds, the virus has infected more than 960 people since 2003, killing roughly half of them. Since the start of 2024, it’s infected dozens of people in the United States—mainly farm workers—and it killed its first person stateside in January of 2025.

So far, H5N1 flu hasn’t acquired the key trick of passing with ease from person to person, which is what could enable a human pandemic. For now, both the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the World Health Organization rate the public health risk as low. But the situation could change.

Title: Tesla sales and production slumped heavily in Q1 2025
Description:
Tesla posted its production and sales numbers for the first quarter of 2025 this morning, and they continue the bad news streak for the electric automaker. Tesla produced 362,615 vehicles in total between January and the end of March, a 16.3 percent decrease from the same period in 2024.

The drop in sales was a little less bad; unlike this time last year, Tesla was able to more closely match production with demand. As a result, the company delivered 336,681 EVs in Q1, a drop of 12.9 percent compared to Q1 2024.

The Models 3 and Y make up the vast majority of Tesla's business—it built 345,454 of them in Q1 2025, a 16.2 percent reduction compared to the same period last year. Despite a recent refresh for the Model Y, which comprised the majority of these two EVs, sales declined by 12.4 percent year over year, with just 323,800 being sold, compared to 369,783 deliveries for Q1 2024.

Things look even worse for the even more outdated Models S and X and the often-recalled Cybertruck. Production for these EVs fell by 18.3 percent year over year to 17,161 units in Q1 2025, with sales dropping year over year by 24.3 percent to just 12,881.

Things were slightly rosier for Tesla's energy storage business, which deployed 10.4 GWh, but this part of the business contributes a small fraction to the bottom line; in 2024, automotive sales accounted for 77 percent of revenues.

Title: Nintendo unveils Switch 2 ahead of June 5 launch
Description:
In a highly anticipated Nintendo Direct presentation this morning, the company revealed new information about the Nintendo Switch 2 hardware and software ahead of a newly announced June 5, 2025, release date. The system will be available on its own or in a bundle with Mario Kart World, for $449 and $499, respectively.

Credit: Nintendo Mario Kart World taking off. Mario Kart World taking off. Credit: Nintendo

The presentation led off with an extended look at a new exclusive launch title, Mario Kart World, which features 24 racers at once on "various regions across the globe" where "you can drive off the race track and go virtually anywhere" in a new "free roam" mode. Characters were shown doing jumps off of walls and wearing multiple different costumes. A new level themed after the original Donkey Kong featured prominently, as did one reminiscent of the Hyrule Castle level of Super Smash Bros. You can also go on "scenic drives with friends" and take photos with them in a new photo mode.

Credit: Nintendo Switch 2 Editions of classic games, purchased as "Upgrade Packs" for original owners. Switch 2 Editions of classic games, purchased as "Upgrade Packs" for original owners. Credit: Nintendo

Certain original Switch games will be re-released in new "Switch 2" editions that add new features and improved visuals. In the Switch 2 edition of Mario Party Jamboree, for instance, players will be able to take part in mouse- and camera-controlled games. And Switch 2 Editions of the two Switch Zelda games will allow access to a new smartphone-powered note-taking feature.

Subscribers to Nintendo's Switch Online + Expansion Pack service will get free upgrade packs for The Legend of Zelda games Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom.

Credit: Nintendo Metroid Prime 4, with mouse controls. Metroid Prime 4, with mouse controls. Credit: Nintendo

Metroid Prime 4 will be available on the original Switch but will support mouse controls on the Switch 2 Edition, as well as 4K 60 fps or 1080p 120 fps gameplay on the newer console.

Switch 2 Edition versions will be available as downloadable updates for players who own the original Switch version of those games.

Nintendo The new C button. The new C button. Nintendo Nintendo Multi-person voice chat during a new Mario Kart experience. Multi-person voice chat during a new Mario Kart experience. Nintendo Nintendo Screen sharing through the Switch 2 Game Chat feature. Screen sharing through the Switch 2 Game Chat feature. Nintendo Multi-person voice chat during a new Mario Kart experience. Nintendo Screen sharing through the Switch 2 Game Chat feature. Nintendo

A new C button on the right Joy-Con of the Switch 2 will let you pull up a chat menu to manage a new "GameChat" feature that allows you to "communicate with friends and family while playing a game." A built-in microphone at the top of the system will "pick up your speaking voice clearly, even at a distance," Nintendo said, and even amid background noise. The button will also let you easily share your game screen with friends, and the feature was shown with four different player views along the bottom of the display, even when players were in different games.

Title: 2025 Audi RS e-tron GT: More range, more power, still drives like an Audi
Description:
Audi provided flights from Washington to Las Vegas and accommodation so Ars could drive the RS e-tron GT. Ars does not accept paid editorial content.

LAS VEGAS—Audi's sleek four-door electric sedan, the e-tron GT, has just received its midlife refresh. Usually, a midlife refresh is mostly cosmetic, intended to prevent the model from feeling too stale in the marketplace. But this time Audi has kept the visual changes to a minimum. There are new wheels and a new interior, as well as redesigned front and rear fascias, although the changes are quite subtle. Instead, there's been a comprehensive reengineering effort under the skin.

Perhaps not quite as comprehensive as the Polestar 2 refresh—which swapped front-wheel drive for rear—but there are now new motors and a new battery pack, which bring with them increased range, a reduced 0–60 mph time, and even faster fast-charging. Audi says it has also worked on the driving dynamics, including adding the same active suspension system we recently experienced in the Porsche Panamera.

As before, the e-tron GT comes in two specifications, but now the base model is the $125,500 S e-tron GT. This now offers 670 hp (500 kW), a 148 hp (110 kW) improvement on last year's model. That drops the 0–60 mph time from 4 seconds down to 3.3, but the 51-mile ( 82 km) increase to its range—now 300 miles (482 km) on a single charge—is probably going to be the most enticing improvement for potential buyers. That's courtesy of a new 105 kWh (gross, 97 kWh usable) battery.

Audi As the name suggests, this car is more a GT than a sports car. As the name suggests, this car is more a GT than a sports car. Audi Audi Bedford Green is a new color and only available on the RS e-tron GT. Bedford Green is a new color and only available on the RS e-tron GT. Audi Audi This bit is new. This bit is new. Audi Bedford Green is a new color and only available on the RS e-tron GT. Audi This bit is new. Audi

Audi didn't have any S e-tron GTs in Las Vegas for us to try, so we had to make do with the RS e-tron GT, which starts at $167,999—$20,000 more than the 2024 version. But you do get quite a lot extra for that. Peak power is up to 912 hp (680 kW), although only in launch mode or if you push the boost control button. But nominal power is around 750 hp (560 kW), 113 hp (85 kW) more than before. That cuts the 0–60 time to just 2.4 seconds, or perhaps faster—one of the other journalists on the drive brought testing instrumentation and logged a 2.1 second 0–60 time. So Audi isn't joking when it says this is the fastest car it has ever built.

Title: Honda will sell off historic racing parts, including bits of Senna’s V10
Description:
Honda's motorsport division must be doing some spring cleaning. Today, the Honda Racing Corporation announced that it's getting into the memorabilia business, offering up parts and even whole vehicles for fans and collectors. And to kick things off, it's going to auction some components from the RA100E V10 engines that powered the McLaren Honda MP4/5Bs of Ayrton Senna and Gerhard Berger to both F1 titles in 1990.

"We aim to make this a valuable business that allows fans who love F1, MotoGP and various other races to share in the history of Honda's challenges in racing since the 1950s," said Koi Watanabe, president of HRC, "including our fans to own a part of Honda's racing history is not intended to be a one-time endeavor, but rather a continuous business that we will nurture and grow."

The bits from Senna's and Berger's V10s will go up for auction at Monterey Car Week later this year, and the lots will include some of the parts seen in the photo above: cam covers, camshafts, pistons, and conrods, with a certificate of authenticity and a display case. And HRC is going through its collections to see what else it might part with, including "heritage machines and parts" from IndyCar, and "significant racing motorcycles."

Title: Ghibli Effect: See how to turn your photos into famous movies style illustrations
Description:
In recent days, a new digital fever has taken over social networks: the creation of images inspired by the traces of Studio Ghibli using chatgpt. OpenAi's image generation function allows you to transform personal photos into acclaimed Japanese -style illustrations - such as Chihiro's trip and the boy and heron. Learn how to try the feature while it is available.

How Image Generation works

The appeal has viralized so much that for a few days, it had to be temporarily suspended due to overload on the servers. Now reactivated, it is accessible even for free users, with a limit of three images per day.

The tool uses artificial intelligence to apply Studio Ghibli's characteristic visual style to photos or descriptions provided by the user.

Step by step to create your illustration

To turn a photo or idea into art, follow these instructions:

Visit the ChatgPT website; Login (or create an account if you don't have it yet); Click on the "+" symbol and then "load from the computer" to send an image; Enter the command: “Turn this image into a Studio Ghibli style illustration”; If you prefer to create an image from scratch, type a detailed description. Example: “Grease a Ghibli -style illustration showing a child running through a field of lilies, dressed in purple clothes.”

The result is a charming image, with soft strokes and nostalgic atmosphere, typical of Japanese studio animations.

[Source: CNN Brazil]

Title: New research claims to have generated electricity from the rotation of the land - but experts still doubt
Description:
A recent study by scientists at Princeton University in the United States has generated debate by stating that it is possible to generate electricity using Earth's rotation as a source of energy. Despite the enthusiasm of the team responsible for the discovery, experts from other institutions have demonstrated skepticism and stressed the need for more testing before considering the viable concept on a large scale.

The experiment and its proposal

The idea was developed from a concept elaborated in 2016. The researchers built a cylindrical device equipped with electrodes and conductors made of manganese and zinc ferrite, positioned at an angle of 57 ° - aligned perpendicular to the rotation of the planet and its magnetic field.

According to scientists, this configuration allowed the generator to produce 17 microvolts of electricity, a result published on the 19th. Although the value is extremely low - a fraction of the voltage of a neuron -, those responsible for the experiment have classified the feat as "controversial but intriguing", highlighting the difficulty of isolating this tension from other physical interference.

The reaction of the scientific community

Despite the enthusiasm of the study authors, other scientists questioned the plausibility of the proposal. Retired physicist Rinke Wijngaarden, who has been with the development of the idea since 2016, says he has not been able to replicate the results in his own experiments two years later. For him, the theory has not yet been convincing enough.

Central criticism revolves around the possibility of interference of opposite forces generated by the reorganization of electrons, which would nullify the electrical current produced. The researchers, in turn, say they have circumvented this obstacle using special materials that prevent this reorganization and maintain the constant electrostatic force in the system.

Next steps and limitations

Despite doubts, scientists behind the research believe in the potential of discovery and plan to expand tests to generate larger amounts of energy. Both sides of the debate agree that more studies are needed before the practical viability of using land rotation can be confirmed as a renewable source of electricity. Until then, the idea follows as a bold proposal that still needs to prove in the field of applied physics.

[Source: UOL]

Title: Seismic warning in Japan projects historical tragedy with devastating human and economic impacts
Description:
Japan, one of the most prone to earthquakes on the planet, has released new worrying predictions about a possible magnitude megatremoto between 8 and 9. According to an official report, an event of this magnitude in the region known as Nankai Trough could cause unprecedented human and financial damage, overcoming past tragedies.

Increasing risk and expected scenario

According to the Japanese government, there is about 80% chance that a large magnitude earthquake in the coming years, specifically along the underwater slot Nankai, located on the southwest coast of Japan. The region is a subduction zone where the seafood clashes with the Eurasian plate, accumulating tensions that have historically generated. Megaterrendous every 100 to 150 years.

In the worst scenario, an earthquake with magnitude 9 could affect about 1.23 million people - approximately 1% of the Japanese population - and cause the death of up to 298,000 people, especially due to tsunamis and night collapses in the middle of winter.

Billionaire economic impact

In addition to human tragedy, the report estimates that economic damage would exceed US $ 1.81 trillion, equivalent to almost half of the country's GDP. The forecast was adjusted based on recent soil data, expansion of flood areas and inflationary pressures. The previous estimate pointed to losses of US $ 1.43 trillion.

History and New Alerts

In 2011, a magnitude 9 earthquake in the northeast region of Japan caused a devastating tsunami and the collapse of three nuclear reactors, killing more than 15,000 people. Since then, concern for new megaterrend has grown. In 2023, the country issued its first formal alert on the possibility of an extreme seismic event in the Nankai Trough region, after a 7.1 magnitude tremor in the bordering area of ​​the valley.

The new report reinforces the need for urgent preparation against a disaster of gigantic proportions.

[Source: CNN Brazil]

Title: Surprising: Fossil was found with the last meal preserved
Description:
An incredibly well -preserved fossil has given scientists a chance to observe, with rich detail, what aquatic life was like in Australia millions of years ago. It is a new species of freshwater fish, found in the archaeological site of McGraths Flat, which belongs to the Miocene period, dated about 16 million years. The finding allowed not only to identify the species, but also to rebuild its behavior, diet and even appearance.

A new exceptionally preserved species

Named Ferruaspis Brocksi, the new species belongs to the Order Osmeriforms, a group that still has living representatives, such as the king fish. The fossils were found in a rare state of conservation, buried in Goethita, an iron oxide mineral that protected delicate structures such as skin, muscles and even internal organs.

Thanks to this level of preservation, described in an article published in the Journal of Vertebrate Paleontology, the researchers were able to observe from soft tissues and body color to the content of the stomach, revealing fundamental aspects of the ecosystem of the time.

Revealed Diet: Miocene Night Hunters

Using high precision microscopy, scientists analyzed the stomach and intestinal tract of fossils and found that Ferruaspis Brocksi fed mainly with chaoborus larvae, known as “ghost mosquito larvae” because they were almost transparent.

In addition to these larvae, insect wings were found and a small bivalve mollusc, similar to a mussel. These clues helped paleontologists understand how the region's river ecosystem was organized, which today is arid, but in the past sheltered dense tropical forests.

Chaoborus larvae often avoid fish with fish, hiding during the day and emerging at night. This indicates that Ferruaspis Brocksi probably had nightly hunting habits, a behavior deducted from the revealed food preference.

Surprising color patterns

One of the highlights of the study was the discovery of preserved pigmented cells, which allowed scientists to identify the visual pattern of the fish. The body was thin, dark at the top and light in the abdominal region, with two colored stripes running the flanks.

This type of color probably served as camouflage in the aquatic environment, protecting predator fish and helping to hunt discreet prey such as Chaoborus larvae.

A rare portrait of a lost ecosystem

The discovery of Ferruaspis Brocksi represents a milestone for paleontology in Oceania. In addition to revealing a new species, the fossil allows you to rebuild behavioral and environmental aspects of a little known period. Thanks to unusual preservation, scientists now have a unique window to understand biodiversity and ecological relationships that existed in a tropical Australia millions of years ago.

[Source: Super Interesting]

Title: Take a long time to answer on WhatsApp can say more than you think, according to psychology
Description:
In times of instant communication, waiting for hours-or even days-for an answer on WhatsApp can generate anxiety, doubts and even misunderstandings. However, psychology shows that this behavior does not always indicate disinterest. Factors such as mental tiredness, social anxiety and the desire to preserve personal limits are among the main reasons. Knowing these reasons can help better understand each other and avoid hasty judgments.

Digital fatigue: when excess stimulus tires

Digital fatigue is one of the most common reasons for the delay in answers. According to a study by Computers in Human Behavior magazine, the constant flow of messages, notifications and availability requirement affect mental well-being.

Thus, some people prefer to move momentarily from the screens to preserve emotional health, which results in a slower pace of response in digital interactions.

Social Anxiety: Fear of being misunderstood

Another reason is social anxiety. People with this trait, or with trends to perfectionism, tend to think too much before sending an answer. The fear of being misinterpreted causes it to take the ideal message.

According to a survey published in the Journal of Anxieth Desorders, socially anxious individuals may take longer to interact digitally due to the fear of judgments or causing bad impression.

Establishment of Limits: Emotional Protection

Some also choose to respond in time as a way of setting healthy limits. The constant urgency of messages can be seen as an invasion, and slowing the answer is a way of maintaining emotional balance.

Studies such as Posted in Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin suggest that in certain cases the delay may indicate disinterest or low emotional priority, but it is not a rule.

The importance of interpreting carefully

Take a long time to answer a message can have several meanings. Understanding that emotional, mental and social factors influence this behavior helps to avoid misunderstandings and cultivate more empathic relationships in the digital environment.

[Source: ND+]

Title: China presents underwater technology that can change the balance of global communications
Description:
Newly informed equipment is capable of cutting submarine cables into extreme depths. Although presented as a civil tool, strategic potential raises international concerns.

Submarine cables form the dorsal spine of the world internet, ensuring data transmission between countries and continents. In a scenario of growing geopolitical tension, these cables have become strategic targets - and the possibility of their interruption poses severe risks to global security. In this context, China has just revealed an unprecedented device, developed specifically to cut submerged cables into great depths, which lights alerts in governments and military forces around the world.

Submarine cables: Vital infrastructure at risk

It is estimated that more than 1.4 billion meters of submarine cables currently connect continents, with plans for many additional kilometers. They are responsible for about 95% of international data traffic - a number ranging from countries. In Australia, for example, almost all communication depends on these cables. In the United States, this percentage reaches 95%, while in China is approximately 75%.

With the growth of services such as streaming, cloud servers and artificial intelligence, submarine cables were considered not only technical but strategic elements. During the war in Ukraine, for example, there were suspicions of sabotage in cables as part of offensive. In other cases, failures have been caused by accidents, but there is always the fear that they may be deliberate actions.

The new tool developed by China

According to a report by South China Morning Post, the state -seafone state -owned vehicle laboratory and the China ship scientific research center have developed a compact but highly efficient device aimed at cutting submarine cables.

The equipment is able to act at depths of up to 4,000 meters, an impressive mark considering that most cables today are installed to smaller depths. The tool structure is sealed with a titanium alloy, resistant to high pressure from the ocean depths.

Its cutting mechanism includes a 1 kilowatt engine and a 150 mm diameter diamond blade, which rotates at 1,600 rotations per minute. This allows you to cut cables with multiple layers of protection, including steel, rubber and polymers, usually used to shield these structures against damage.

Integration with Chinese submersible

The design of the equipment has been designed to be coupled to manned and non -manned submersible vehicles, such as the models Haiou and Fendouzhe, both used in maritime exploration missions.

Haidou is an autonomous submersible with a format similar to that of a fish, used for mapping and research of great depths. Already Fendouzhe is a manned vehicle, also focused on scientific studies, but now can carry this new device with potential for military use.

Geopolitical implications

Although those responsible for the project state that the device was created for civil purposes, such as rescue and underwater mining operations, the international context in which the tool was announced generated restlessness. This is the first time that a country has officially declares to have technology focused on cutting submarine cables - something that until then was just speculated.

Revelation arises in a moment of growing global tension on the safety of communication infrastructures. In a possible conflict, cutting strategic cables can compromise military systems, government communications and the operation of online companies and services worldwide.

Protection Strategies

Given the real possibility of sabotage, countries and organizations have sought to reinforce the protection of their submarine cables. NATO, for example, created the “Baltic Sentry” mission, which monitors critical areas with the use of drones, airplanes and war ships, especially in regions near the Baltic Sea.

Private companies are also investing in advanced monitoring solutions, with sensors and artificial intelligence to detect vibrations or attempts to cut cables. These initiatives aim to offer damage quickly and ensure the necessary redundancy so that if a cable is interrupted, the data can be redirected by other routes.

The challenge of multiple interruptions

Today, when a cable is damaged, communication systems are prepared to circumvent the problem by redirecting traffic by other cables. However, simultaneous interruption of various cables, especially at strategic points, can cause significant failures in data systems.

The possibility of coordinating tools of tools such as Chinese raises real concerns about the vulnerability of global communication networks. It is not just slow internet or instability in calls, but possible collapses on banking, financial, defense and even hospital operations that depend on continuous communication.

A new era of submarine threats?

With China opening the game and openly presenting its new technology, the dynamics of maritime security enters a new phase. Having such a specific and powerful cable device creates a precedent and increases the pressure for other nations to develop - or reveal - their own defense technologies or attack in the underwater environment.

If before cutting a submarine cable was an action considered extreme and difficult to perform, it can now become more accessible, fast and accurate, transforming the bottom of the sea into another potential scenario for geopolitical disputes.

Chinese technology is presented as an advance for peaceful purposes, but its destructive potential does not go unnoticed. The line between civil and military use becomes increasingly faint, and the challenge now is to establish international standards that guarantee the protection of this vital infrastructure, before the next crisis comes from the ocean bottom.

[Source: Earth]

Title: John Wick is back - and the franchise is just starting
Description:
John Wick fans have plenty of reasons to celebrate. During CinemaCon 2025, it was officially confirmed that John Wick: Chapter 5 is already under development, with Keanu Reeves returning to the main role that consecrated him. But this is not the only news-the franchise universe is about to grow like never before, with a lively precelane and two spin-offs on the horizon.

John Wick's impossible mission will be revealed - in anime

One of the most exciting surprises was the announcement of an animated prequel that will show, for the first time, the famous "impossible task" that allowed John to try to move away from the underworld of crime. This mission was only cited in the first productions, but never actually shown.

According to Lionsgate, the animated movie takes place before the first John Wick, and portrays the moment when the protagonist eliminates all his rivals in a single night, thus conquering the right to leave the high summit and live with his beloved, Helen.

The production will be written by Vanessa Taylor (Game of Thrones, the shape of water) and directed by Shannon Tindle (Ultraman: Rising). The director of the main franchise, Chad Stahelski, acts as a co-producer and celebrated the expansion of the universe in anime format:

"I've always been fascinated by the anime. It has always been a great influence on me, especially in John Wick's saga. Turning this universe into anime looks a natural step. I believe this media can expand our characters and action in hitherto unimaginable ways."

Spin-offs: Ballerina and Caine gain protagonism

In addition to animation and fifth chapter, the franchise expands with new spin-offs. The already announced Ballerina, starring Ana de Armas, debuts in June and promises to bring a new female perspective to the universe of professional killers.

But the big revelation was the confirmation of a new film starring Donnie Yen, who returns to the role of the blind killer Caine, introduced in John Wick: Chapter 4. In addition to acting, Yen will also be the project director, who will start filmed later this summer.

Mattson Tomlin, screenwriter of The Batman Part II, signs the script. According to Yen, the responsibility is great, but the motivation too:

"John Wick's productions have raised action cinema to a new level. I'm grateful to Lionsgate for trusting me this mission. I'm deeply inspired to bring this new chapter to life."

Stahelski also commented on the project:

“Caine is one of my favorite characters in John Wick's universe. Diving in her story will be fascinating. We want to create a modern Kung Fu classic - and no one better than Donnie Yen to lead this project. His mastery of action, culture and narrative makes him the ideal director.”

What to expect from the future of the franchise?

With so many projects in progress, John Wick's universe seems far from retiring. The franchise has already made it clear that it is willing to explore not only the character of Keanu Reeves, but the whole ecosystem of characters, rules and organizations that made it so unique.

From live-action cinema to the world of animation, going through parallel stories and new narratives, John Wick is becoming a true multimedia saga, with the potential to master different formats in the coming years.

Title: Micro -Company: The new trend of generation Z to rest before old age
Description:
Generation Z is transforming the way we think work and rest. Instead of waiting for traditional retirement to slow down, many young people are choosing to take long periods of break through their professional life. This practice, known as micro -postation, has been observed among some millennials since 2007, but has now gained prominence as a dominant trend among new generation professionals.

What is Micro -Postority?

The term “micro-position” was popularized by Timothy Ferriss by Timothy Ferriss. The proposal is simple: instead of working intensely for 40 years to retire at the end of life, why not interleave moments of rest throughout the professional trajectory?

According to career experts, such as Marlene Pöhlmann of Robert Half agency, micro -postation is a voluntary career interruption, usually among jobs, which can last several months. During this period, people travel, take care of the family or invest in hobbies and personal development - without the pressures of daily work.

Why is generation Z adopting this model?

Generation Z, born between the mid -1990s and 2010, has a different relationship with work. They value the balance between personal and professional life, prioritize mental health and are less willing to sacrifice their youth by uncertain promises of future stability.

In addition, the world of work has become more flexible. According to Pöhlmann, young people today have more diverse trajectories, going through up to 10 or more companies throughout their careers. The idea of ​​a single stable job for decades is no longer the norm. As a result, planned breaks are seen as natural - and even necessary.

Another factor that motivates this choice is insecurity regarding traditional retirement. Many young people doubt that when they retire in the future, they can really enjoy the benefits provided for by current social security systems.

Benefits and Risks of Micro -Postance

Jonathan H. Westover, researcher and member of Forbes Council, defends practice as an important instrument for improving mental health and preventing burnout. Research indicates that regular work breaks reduce stress and increase overall well-being.

During these breaks, professionals can devote time to self -care, explore new interests and recharge their physical and mental energies. However, as experts warn, not everything is flowers.

Sugure teacher Mariappanadar from an Australian university recalls that these breaks are not always paid or structured as a “sabbatical year”. They are often financed with personal economies or public aid, which can pose a financial risk, especially in high -cost countries.

In addition, interrupting your career can affect future salaries, make promotions difficult or decrease visibility in the workplace. "Who is not present, is not seen - and this can make a difference in strategic decisions within a company," says Pöhlmann.

How does the market see this practice?

There is still resistance in some cultures and sectors. In many countries, having a continuous professional history is still seen as a sign of commitment. In addition, there are those who argue that young people should take advantage of youth energy to work harder and gain experience, especially at the beginning of their career.

Being present in the corporate environment, for example, may favor important connections. Great leaders have already mentioned that working in person in office increases the chances of professional growth, while remote work or prolonged absences can limit opportunities.

Source: Genbeta

Title: Is your dog stressed? Discover the simplest and most effective method to calm it
Description:
Dogs are dear family members for millions of people in the world. Taking care of the emotional health of these animals is as important as taking care of their diet or physical health. Like humans, dogs also suffer from anxiety and stress, and this can manifest in quite evident ways in behavior.

Among several known strategies, a technique has caught the attention of experts and is gaining space: reading aloud to your dog.

Read to the dog: Why does it work?

British organization Dogs Trust released a video in which volunteers read stories to dogs in shelters. The result? Many of the animals calmed down quickly - some even fell asleep. The sound of the human voice, when used quietly, creates a safety and relaxation environment, especially for more sensitive dogs.

According to Pawsitive Results Terry Cuyler, dogs are extremely sensitive to the tone of voice. “When you read to your dog, your voice turns into a sign that everything is fine,” he explains. This causes the animal to associate that moment with calm and comfort.

Children's books are a good choice as they use short phrases and simple language, facilitating the animal's attention to the sound of reading.

How to include reading in your pet's routine

The ideal, according to Cuyler, is to establish a fixed time for this moment. Dogs like routine and predictability, which helps reduce anxiety. Reading every day at the same time - especially after a walk or late afternoon - can help the animal relax and sleep better.

Also, it is important to use a smooth and constant voice tone. Avoid sudden changes in intonation or volume. The idea is that the dog associates its reading with a state of tranquility.

How to know if your dog is anxious?

Dr. Charlotte Rice, an expert in animal welfare, proposes the Peep test, which helps tutors identify signs of stress in their pets:

P (posture): Is the dog curved, rigid or with the tail between the legs?

And (eyes): Eyes very open, with dilated pupils?

And (ears): Are they lowered or facing back?

P (position): Does he try to hide, move away or get still?

If the animal presents these signs, reading can be a simple, accessible and effective way to relieve its tension.

What causes stress in dogs?

Several factors can trigger stress in dogs, including:

Changes in the environment: reforms, home change, new family members or travel.

Lack of routine: irregular times or prolonged absence of tutors.

Limited socialization: little contact with other animals or people, fear or aggressiveness.

Trauma: abandonment, mistreatment or negative experiences.

Other factors: veterinarian visits, hospitalizations, loneliness, lack of physical and mental stimuli.

Physical and behavioral symptoms of stress

Stressed dogs may have symptoms such as:

Accelerated breathing or high heartbeat

Excessive hair

Bostezes and Frequent Salivation

Cocket or compulsive licking

Vomiting or diarrhea without apparent cause

Barking, growl or destructive behaviors

Although it is not always possible to eliminate the causes of stress, the way we help dogs will face them can make all the difference.

Source: Canal26

Title: Trump changes the rules of the global game: new tariffs will redefine US commerce with the world
Description:
President Donald Trump is about to take another bold step in reformulating the United States trade policy. On Wednesday, it will announce a new package of generalized reciprocal tariffs, whose entry into force will be immediate. The measure marks a break with decades of multilateral agreements and can trigger serial retaliation by various business partners.

IMMOTIVE EFFECT AND FOCUS IN THE AUTOMOTIVE SECTOR

The announcement is scheduled to take place at 4 pm (US east coast time) in the White House rose garden, according to presidential spokesman Karoline Leavitt. The main news is the application of a 25% rate on global car imports, starting on April 3.

Although the complete details have not yet been disclosed, Trump has argued that these new tariffs aim to match the rates applied by other countries and combat non-tariff barriers that, according to him, impair the competitiveness of US exports.

Strategic change: from multilateralism to bilateral pressure

These measures represent a turn in US commercial policy, which for decades followed the principles of the World Trade Organization (WTO). Now, the focus moves to direct negotiations, country per country, with fares that may vary according to the commercial behavior of each nation.

Sources linked to the government indicate that Trump can adopt different rates below the universal value of 20% initially considered, but selectively applied to more than 15 countries. The main criterion would be the commercial surplus maintained with the US, as the Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent said.

Cumulative impacts and risk of commercial escalation

The announced rates will be cumulative. That is, products already charged may suffer additional increases. A practical example: a car made in Mexico, which today pays 2.5% tariff, can be taxed up to 52.5%, adding the new measures.

Since taking over his term just over ten weeks, Trump has imposed 20% rates on China imports related to fentanyl fighting, as well as restoring 25% steel and aluminum rates, reaching products more than $ 150 billion.

In addition, temporary relief granted to products from Canada and Mexico expires today, which further increases the tension among North America's business partners.

Internal and external reactions to the new package

Internally, the decision generated restlessness. According to a survey cited by the Federal Reserve of Atlanta, entrepreneurs expect prices, hiring slowdown and lower growth in the coming months.

In the international scenario, the answer did not take long. Canada, Mexico and the European Union have already signaled that they prepare retaliation measures. In a recent conversation, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carnery and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum classified US actions as “unjustified” and reinforced the need to protect regional competitiveness with respect to sovereignty.

The cost to the consumer and the risks to global trade

Economists warn that strategy can be expensive for the ordinary citizen. A Yale University Budget Lab study estimates that an additional 20% increase in tariffs can cost about $ 3,400 a year, with high price only.

In addition to the direct impact on the home economy, the new package poses a risk to the stability of global trade. Since February, financial markets have reflected this uncertainty: the loss of capitalization in the scholarships exceeds $ 5 trillion.

Source: Infobae

Title: Find out how to travel in time with google maps: see the past with just one click
Description:
Google Maps is not just a navigation guide; He keeps a true time capsule. Although many people use the service just to know how to get to their destinations, few know that the platform offers access to images of how things were in the past. This feature allows you to see how they were specific places in past years with just a few clicks, without having to install anything or configure anything.

The functionality hidden on Google Maps

Since 2007, Google Street View cars have captured images of millions of places around the world. However, there is a little known feature that allows users to see what these images were like in the past. To access this feature, just use Google Maps on your computer or smartphone.

On your phone, open the Google Maps app, look for any address and hold the desired point to fix a pin. Then open the street view view. By touching the image, you will see an option called "see more dates." By selecting it, a timeline will be displayed with images of different years.

On the computer, just go to Google Maps through the browser, find the place and click it to open the street view. At the bottom right of the screen, you will see a miniature of the image, and clicking it, will open the street view. If there are old images available, you can use sliding control to travel in time visually.

Most interesting is that it is not necessary to install anything additional, nor make registrations or complicated settings. Everything is available to any user who knows how to access.

Reduces your world like never before

The most common reaction when using this function is simple astonishment. Who would imagine I could see the facade of your home as it was in 2008? Details such as vintage cars, landscape changes and even disappeared trees can make you embark on a true nostalgic ride.

In addition to the emotional value, this tool offers a unique perspective on the transformation of cities over time. Architects, urban planners and documentary photographers use it to study urban changes or reconstruct scenarios for investigations. In some cases, it was also used in police investigations, allowing you to view scenes as they were years ago.

Seeing a neighborhood before its modernization or a street before building a building can provide valuable information about the growth and development of a city, as well as being an opportunity to better understand the past of a familiar place.

A valuable tool for business and history

In addition to being a fascinating tool to revive the past, the function also has great practical utility in several areas. If you are thinking of moving or buying a property, you can check how the neighborhood has evolved over the years. Was it a quiet street? Was there more vegetation? What existed before that empty terrain?

For business, this feature is a visual gold mine. Seeing how the facade of a trade or shopping center has changed over the years can be a great way to demonstrate the evolution and trajectory of a brand. These images can even be used on social networks or on the company's website, telling a transformation story.

In cities that have undergone rapid changes, the tool offers a deeper understanding of how urban processes shaped the present. Each image captured is a visual record, revealing moments that could otherwise be lost.

The past is closer than you imagine

The most impressive about this feature is that it makes the past accessible without having to look for old documents or go to historical files. With just a few clicks, you can access a digital time capsule that is available publicly and is constantly updated.

The next time you use Google Maps to look for an address, remember that you may be a click to rediscover a forgotten version of your world. The past is not as far away as it seems, and now, thanks to this functionality, you can visit it whenever you want.

Title: The new way to marry without romantic love is gaining ground among young people - and makes perfect sense in 2025
Description:
In times of tiredness of dating applications and questions about relationship models, a new type of union is becoming a tendency among young people of generation Z. They are the so -called “lavender weddings”: alliances based on friendship, mutual support and coexistence, but without sexual or romantic involvement.

What is a lavender wedding?

The term “lavender marriage” originates in the nineteenth century, when it was used to describe unions between men and homosexual women who sought to hide their sexual orientation from society. Today, the concept has gained a new dimension among younger people: it is an affective partnership without romance, but with commitment, coexistence and shared life goals.

These marriages are not facade relationships, but conscious agreements between two people who want to divide life under a logic of cooperation. Motivation can be emotional, practical, financial or a mixture of all.

A response to uncertain times

Part of the popularity of lavender marriages comes from a challenging economic and social context. According to The Washington Post, generation Z spent 31% more housing than millennials spent ten years ago. At the same time, applications like Tinder and Bumble have lost users and market value, reflecting tiredness with casual encounters and fleeting relationships.

At this juncture, lavender marriage emerges as a practical and affective solution: it offers stability, coexistence and even access to legal benefits such as joint health plans, inheritance and rights in medical decisions. For many people, it is a way to build an emotional and logistical support base without having to meet the expectations of traditional relationships.

It's not just about economics

Although the financial factor weighs, the lavender wedding appeal goes beyond that. Many people simply want a life shared with someone of trustworthy, without the pressures of romantic love or sexuality. For these partnerships, priority is care, empathy and mutual planning - not passion.

These unions may include expenditure division, common life projects, well -defined coexistence agreements and even the possibility of each partner to maintain other romantic or sexual relationships outside the union.

How does it work in practice?

On social networks, especially in Tiktok, the theme exploded. Hashtag #LaVendemariage already accumulates millions of views, with personal reports, advice and even proposals from apps dedicated to those seeking this type of partnership.

The secret of success, according to those who live this model, is in clear communication and in aligned expectations. Each couple defines their own terms: There are those who live as “best married friends”, who raise children together, who invests in shared professional projects - and all without involving the romantic element.

A new vision on coexistence and affection

Although the starting point of lavender marriages is platonic, some evolve to deeper affective relationships. However, this is neither the rule nor objective. The focus is on reimaginating what it means to “build a life for two” in a world in transformation.

This trend also represents a critique - or at least an alternative - to the romantic ideal that still dominates much of social narratives. Instead of waiting for the soul mate, many young people are choosing trustworthy partners with whom they can create a home based on mutual care, stability and complicity.

Source: Infobae

Title: The most disturbing return of the year: the series that reveals the dilemmas of the future already has a date to debut
Description:
The series that redefined modern science fiction is back. With a sharp look at the ethical impacts of technological advances, Black Mirror returns to Netflix on April 10 with his long -awaited seventh season. Created by Charlie Brooker, British production resumes its anthological format with independent episodes, and this time, it brings a sequence of one of the most iconic chapters of the series. Get ready for stories that mix tension, reflection and inescapable discomfort.

Six episodes, six possible futures

In this new season, Black Mirror features six unpublished episodes: ordinary people, Bète Noire, Eulogy, Toys, Reverie Hotel and USS Callister: Into Infinity. Each chapter addresses, in a unique way, the dangers and dilemmas that arise from the increasingly intimate relationship between humanity and technology.

According to the creator of the series, this season represents a "return to the roots" of production - with less explicit terror, but maintaining the satirical, dark and sophisticated tone that has consecrated the series since 2011. The narratives have been provocative, exploring the shadows of the digital age and the human condition.

Reality or script?

One of the highlights is the episode Hotel Reverie, where a movie star finds herself trapped within a simulation that recreates a classic of British cinema. In this universe generated by artificial intelligence, the only way out is to follow the film's script - literally. History raises questions about how much technology can manipulate reality, confusing fiction and real life.

Another striking episode is ordinary people, who brings a deep emotional dilemma: a man needs to resort to advanced technology to save his wife, but the choice is accompanied by a very high ethical price. These stories, which mix science fiction with moral dilemmas, are the heart of the series - and the reason for its huge cultural impact.

The long -awaited continuation of USS Callister

A big news of this season is the sequence of USS Callister, one of the most acclaimed episodes of the fourth season. Titled USS Callister: Into Infinity, the new story follows the ship's crew now led by Nanette Cole after the fall of the tyrant Robert Daly.

This is the first time Black Mirror has continued an earlier episode, breaking his tradition of autonomous stories. The choice reflects the potential of the narrative universe of USS Callister, which combines social criticism, satire with pop culture and an engaging sci-fi aesthetic. Ancient fans will surely have plenty of reasons to get excited.

Weight cast and bold promises

To bring these new plots to life, the series has a starry cast. Names like Paul Giamatti, Awkwafina and Emma Corin are part of the episodes of the new season. According to Brooker, the scripts will bring “some horrible things” - but always with the irony and intelligence that marked the success of the series.

The combination of intense performances with provocative scripts reinforces the series's commitment to generate not only entertainment, but also critical reflection on today's world.

Reflexes of an ever -closer future

Since his debut, Black Mirror has been known for portraying future dystopics who, over the years, seem frighteningly plausible. This seventh season follows tradition, addressing topics such as manipulated memories, invasive artificial intelligence and the effects of fame in digital times.

More than predicting the future, the series invites the audience to look at the present with other eyes - and to question the real impact of the technologies that surround us. The return of the series is at the same time a warning and a provocation.

Source: Infobae

Title: The most expensive country in South America: because the cost of living in Uruguay surprises
Description:
The Numbeo International Platform, which specializes in comparing living costs, revealed in its 2025 report that Uruguay occupies first place in South America, remarkably overcoming other countries in the region. With a big difference in points, the country demonstrates a distinct economic scenario that can surprise those who think of living or investing in the region.

The platform that reveals the secrets of the cost of living

Created in 2009, the Numbeo platform has become the largest global collaborative database on the cost of living. It offers updated information about prices, quality of life, health services, crime, among other factors, allowing direct comparisons between cities and countries. The contribution of users around the world helps build a detailed overview of the economic and social reality of each place.

In addition to comparing the cost of living, the platform also analyzes factors such as rent price, purchasing power of residents, health services and traffic congestion. It is therefore considered a valuable reference source for those who plan to change, travel or invest in other regions of the world.

Uruguay: the most expensive country in South America

According to Numbeo's latest report in 2025, Uruguay stands out as the most expensive country in South America, with a score of 46.33. This result puts the country in an undisputed position of leadership, with a significant difference from the second place, Argentina, which obtained 35.75 points.

The difference of more than ten points between the two countries demonstrates that Uruguay occupies a prominent position in the living costs ranking in the region. On the other hand, Paraguay, with a score of only 23.02, appears at the end of the list, highlighting the economic disparity within South America. Globally, Uruguay occupies the 10th place in the ranking, being surpassed only by destinations such as the virgin islands of the United States.

What makes Uruguay so expensive?

The high cost of living in Uruguay is mainly related to its dependence on imports. The country has no large industries or produces hydrocarbons, which forces it to import a wide range of products and inputs, considerably raising prices. This directly affects the cost of essential goods such as food, technology and fuels.

In addition, the high level of taxes on various products also contributes to the price increase. The economic structure of Uruguay, although stable, has barriers to competition in certain sectors, which, added to the small domestic market, results in higher prices compared to other countries in the region.

Is it worth living in the most expensive country in South America?

Despite high costs, Uruguay maintains a good reputation for quality of life. Political stability, low crime rate, quality public education, and the universal health system are factors that make the country attractive to many people, especially foreigners who decide to settle in the country. For them, the benefits of living in a safe and stable environment compensate for the high cost of living.

However, for local citizens, high prices can become a difficult cargo. The cost of living can be a challenge, especially for those who do not have access to higher income or public benefits.

As the global economy evolves and new dynamics emerge in South America, it will be interesting to note whether Uruguay will be able to maintain its leadership position in the cost of living ranking or whether other countries will start to climb this index, revealing changes in the region's economic reality.

Title: Did you know that the hottest river on the planet is in South America? The temperature exceeds 90 ° C
Description:
South America is a continent full of natural wonders. From majestic mountains to exuberant forests, the region houses phenomena that intrigue science. Among these wonders, there is a river that escapes all the known rules: the hottest river on planet Earth. Located in a remote area of ​​Peru, it is a true nature jewel of nature - and a powerful warning on the impacts of the climate.

A boiling river hidden in the forest

The Shanay-Timpishka River, better known as the Fervent River, is located in the Peru-East Center in the Amazon jungle. According to the BBC, it is considered a unique geothermal phenomenon in the world. At some points, their waters reach temperatures above 90 ° C, which makes the river the highest known temperature on the planet.

This extreme heat has no volcanic origin, as it would be common in phenomena of this type, but in underground geothermal sources. The heat comes from the depths of the earth and warms the water directly, which creates an almost surreal scenario in the middle of the rainforest.

The particularities of this impressive river

The boiling river is not just a natural spectacle - it is also the object of intense scientific studies. Some of the characteristics that make it so special include:

Scorching Temperature:

The waters of Shanay-Timpishka can reach between 86 ° C and 95 ° C. In some parts, it is possible to see animals falling into the water and dying almost instantly due to the high temperature.

Impact on local flora:

The vegetation around the river changes dramatically in the warmer areas. Plant density decreases visibly, and certain species completely disappear on the banks where the temperature is most extreme.

Natural Laboratory on Climate Change:

Scientists consider Rio a true "natural experiment." Because it is subject to such high temperatures, it serves as a model to understand how the global increase in temperatures can affect integer ecosystems.

Research Challenges:

Studying the river is not a simple task. The combination of extreme heat, intense and difficult humidity transforms each scientific expedition into a risky and exhaustive mission.

Resistant species:

Despite adverse conditions, some plants, such as Giant Ceiba, can survive near the river. This suggests that certain species may have greater heat tolerance - something essential on a rapidly warming planet.

Why is this discovery so important?

The existence of the boiling river goes far beyond scientific curiosity. He raises fundamental questions about how the planet answers environmental changes and to what extent ecosystems can adapt to warming.

In addition, it reinforces the importance of the Amazon as a strategic region for global ecological balance. Understanding phenomena like Shanay-Timpishka can provide crucial clues to predict the climate's future-and how to mitigate its effects.

Source: Diario Uno

Title: Dems Celebrate Elon’s Humiliation After MAGA Loss in Wisconsin
Description:
Elon Musk spent $20 million in Wisconsin trying to elect a MAGA judge to the state Supreme Court, just to lose by 10 points on Tuesday. And there are already reports that Musk’s time in the White House may be limited due to President Donald Trump’s patience wearing thin. But if you ask leaders of the Democratic Party, who see the billionaire oligarch as electoral poison, they want Musk to keep campaigning for Republicans.

The Democratic National Committee held a press call Wednesday to celebrate the party’s victory in Wisconsin, encouraging Musk to keep being the public face of the Republican Party.

“We should be putting Elon Musk into every state right now campaigning because he’s actually a huge boon to Democrats right now,” said DNC chair Ken Martin. “And frankly, the American people are quite frustrated with this guy and what he’s been doing since Donald Trump was inaugurated. So the more Elon Musk wants to get out there, I say go for it, Elon. There’s plenty of other states we’d love you to campaign in.”

The chair of the Democratic Party of Wisconsin Ben Wikler echoed that sentiment, pointing out the destruction Musk has wrought as the head of DOGE, the so-called Department of Government Efficiency, which has unilaterally dismantled federal agencies like USAID and fired tens of thousands of federal workers.

“Elon Musk’s spending comes with it the taint of an administration that is attacking Social Security, that is dismantling unions, that is ravaging the Veterans Administration, that is doing things that have always been known to be political suicide,” Wikler said. “And for Elon Musk to then tie himself to Republican candidates is the political kiss of death.”

But Wikler also seemed to revel in the fact that Musk was still in the White House, perhaps betraying the Democratic Party’s tendency to focus too heavily on optics and elections rather than the substance of what Musk is destroying in between elections.

“I hope that he stays at the White House with Donald Trump,” Wikler said of Musk, “that they appear together in the Oval Office, that he dominates cabinet meetings, and that he poses for photos with every member of the Republican House and Senate.”

The posing part makes sense. The Tesla CEO appears to be toxic to regular voters if the vote tally in Wisconsin on Tuesday is any guide—to say nothing of the protests and vandalism at Tesla dealerships around the world. But Wikler’s message that Musk should continue to be involved in day-to-day decisions by the Trump regime clearly runs counter to what Democrats should want. And Wikler may have realized his verbal slip-up, later saying during the press call that he wanted Musk to get stripped of any real power.

“Elon Musk should become Donald Trump’s special envoy for midterm elections and go out and speak on the campaign trail in every possible state in every possible district,” Wikler said. “At the same time, Elon Musk should be removed as quickly as possible from any position of power over the federal government. The damage that he’s doing to irreparable institutions that have served families across the state of Wisconsin and across the country, it’s a horror. Elon Musk is gutting the Social Security Administration, gutting the Veterans Administration.”

Democrats have finally started to push back against Musk in various ways, though some tactics may prove to be more effective than others. Rep. Jamie Raskin, ranking member of the House Judiciary Committee, sent a letter Wednesday to FBI director Kash Patel asking for an investigation into Musk’s ties to China. It’s an important ask, given Musk’s interest in interfering with global politics from Germany to the UK.

But Democrats clearly need to remember that this isn’t just about winning or losing elections. The part that really matters is what happens in between those elections. And while Musk might be hurting Republicans at the ballot box right now, he can still do tremendous damage between now and the next election.

Title: DARPA Unintentionally Invents New Rocket ‘Radar’ Thanks to SpaceX
Description:
While listening in on the atmosphere, a team of researchers from the U.S. military’s Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) picked up unexpected disturbances caused by a SpaceX rocket plummeting through the atmosphere toward its landing site.

DARPA’s AtmoSense program seeks to use Earth’s atmosphere as a global sensor by measuring acoustic and electromagnetic waves propagating through the atmosphere, and attempting to trace them back to a specific disturbance event that took place on Earth. In doing so, DARPA hopes to be able to trace underground explosions or other national security threats using the signals detected from the atmosphere.

During its latest round of listening to the atmosphere, a team used AtmoSense to study sound waves created by controlled explosions in New Mexico. While conducting this work, the team behind the program made an unplanned discovery after noticing something unusual in the sensor data.

“As the team was looking at the data, they saw a huge drop in what’s called total electron content that puzzled them,” Michael Nayak, program manager of AtmoSense, said in a statement. “Imagine that you have water going through a hose. That’s a flow of electrons, and if you put your fist in front of the hose, you’ll notice a significant drop in water volume coming out of the hose.”

After analyzing the data, the team was able to trace the disturbance to a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket reentry that took place on the same day as the test. “Then they decided to pull other SpaceX reentry data, across dozens of launches, to see if they could spot a similar electron drop,” Nayak added. “The phenomenon is highly repeatable.”

Using AtmoSense, the team inadvertently discovered a new technique to identify objects reentering through Earth’s atmosphere, according to Nayak. The researchers behind the program will share the most recent results from AtmoSense during an upcoming virtual workshop being held from April 15 to 17.

Falcon 9 is the hardest working rocket in the game, with over 450 missions under its belt. SpaceX’s Falcon 9 is a partially reusable, two-stage rocket that launches payloads into orbit, then returns to Earth for a controlled landing, allowing its first stage to be recovered and reused.

Title: The Nintendo Switch 2 Is Finally Here and It’ll Cost You $450
Description:
Nintendo’s full showcase of the Switch 2 has finally arrived. The Switch 2 is bold in black and spunky with its colorful joystick accents, but its real capabilities are more than skin deep. Nintendo is back and is once again declaring itself as the king of fun gaming devices, even if that means you may not be playing your games with the greatest graphical fidelity. It launches on June 5 in the U.S. with pre-orders beginning on April 9.

See Nintendo Switch 2 Livestream at Best Buy

There will be a bundle with Switch 2 and the upcoming game Mario Kart World, that will be on sale for $500. If you just want the console it’ll be going for $450.

The newly added “C” button enables GameChat, which combines with the Switch 2’s built-in mic to talk to friends while playing games online. The system will show the streams from your friends’ screens, even if they’re playing different games than you. You can also expand your friends’ game screens to see more of what they’re playing.

You need to have a Switch Online subscription for GameChat, but new buyers will get a one-month subscription to try out those features. The Switch 2 also supports a separate camera accessory that centers the image on players’ heads, although we don’t know how big the camera sensor is, considering the blurry images shown off in the Direct stream. Nintendo showed how player’s backgrounds are automatically blocked out, but we’ll see if Nintendo offers players control over background blur.

Nintendo gave us a tiny peak of its Switch 2 back in January, but on Wednesday the legacy Japanese game maker finally pulled the curtain back on its sequel to 2017’s Nintendo Switch. The Switch 2 is an iteration on the company’s dockable handheld design from 2017, though with more top vents and a few extra buttons on top. It houses a 7.9-inch, 1080p IPS LCD display, not OLED like on the $350 Switch OLED from 2021. The new JoyCons don’t slide onto the controller, but slot into the main body and are held together through magnets. There are two switches on the rear side of the JoyCons that allow you to unlatch each individual stick. They’re both compatible with their own straps and new charging grip.

Nintendo said the screen supports HDR for better visual contrast, and the system also includes a better speaker and in-built microphone. The console now includes two USB-C ports, with one on top and one on the bottom. The system will also support 3D audio through supported headphones.

Though the JoyCons sport a more rounded design than the original, the real difference between the last gen and this version lies in its capabilities. The right-side JoyCon includes a large “C” switch under the Home button which makes a chime when you press it. For those wondering, if those rumored mouse controls were real, they are! Both left and right JoyCons support it and Nintendo showed off several games that use the feature.

The latest Switch now includes 256 GB of storage, eight times as much as the original Switch’s 32 GB. The beefy Switch 2 dock supports 4K resolution for compatible games and HDR is supported in TV mode. The dock includes its own fan system for cooling.

See Nintendo Switch 2 Livestream at Best Buy

There are a few things the new handheld won’t support from the original Switch. Switch 2 will only work with microSD Express cards, older, non-express cards are out. There’s a new, exclusive Switch 2 Pro controller as well. At least, Nintendo Switch Online will remain consistent between platforms. The big news is that the Expansion Pack will now support GameCube games, including Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker and F-Zero GX. These games will support both local and online multiplayer for up to four players. There’s a new version of the GameCube controller also coming to Switch 2, though it will be exclusive for Switch Online subscribers.

As for games, Nintendo said there are three types of games compatible with the Switch 2. The first is Switch 2-exclusive games. Other games will get an “upgrade” for Switch 2, such as improved visuals and compatibility with features like mouse controls. Super Mario Party Jamboree, for example, now supports the camera modes and JoyCon mouse. Unfortunately, you have to purchase an upgrade pack for these games if you already own them.

There will be Switch 2 editions for both Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom and Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. There’s a special connection for the Switch 2 versions of these games with the Nintendo Today! app that helps you navigate the game or share screenshots with friends. Maybe it will finally help you collect all those Koroks you’re still missing. As expected, there will be a Switch and Switch 2 version of Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, and Pokémon Legends Z-A.

There were a few other games shown off in Nintendo’s Switch 2 reveal, but none as big as Elden Ring which will finally come to Switch systems in a “Tarnished Edition” arriving sometime this year. Hades II and Street Fighter 6 will arrive on Switch 2, as well. Hogwarts Legacy and Civilization VII—which will support mouse controls—are coming to the platform later this year. Finally, the most surprising ports may be Cyberpunk 2077 and Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth running on a Switch 2. If it can run on Steam Deck perfectly fine, we’re sure the wizards at CD Projekt Red can bring it to Nintendo’s slimmer handheld.

Nintendo started its stream by showing off Mario Kart World, a Switch 2 exclusive. It’s features a redesigned Donkey Kong, new power-ups, and a few hints at new tracks. Each track will have different day/night settings as well as weather effects. The big update is an open-world type “free-roam” environment to discover new routes or just take a few selfies with friends. It launches the same day as Nintendo Switch 2 and will have its own Direct on April 17.

As for exclusives, Switch 2 will have its fair share. For one, FromSoftware is debuting a new game called DuskBloods with a visual style that feels much more like Bloodborne than its other recent titles. That game will arrive in 2026. Finally, for those who still appreciate the Dynasty Warriors formula, the Zelda-themed Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment will launch in 2025.

If you need to get excited about more exclusives with Nitendo’s most beloved characters, Donkey Kong is finally getting a new platformer with morphable terrain in Donkey Kong Bonanza. That title should be arriving on July 17 this year. Also, Masahiro Sakurai, the creator of Super Smash Bros., is back with a new Kirby Air Ride, which should be available sometime in 2026.

Some of what Nintendo showed at its latest direct are details you’re already well aware of if you’ve been following the ultra-hyped handheld these last few months. The company’s previous Nintendo Direct debuted Virtual Game Cards as the new way the Nintendo Switch can store your digitally-purchased games. The Virtual Game Cards also double as a way of lending games to friends and for moving titles between two Switch consoles you own.

Nintendo has been preparing for this moment for the past two years, though we’re hoping the stock situation is better than it was with the original Switch. Nobody wants to stand in line for hours just to get their hands on a console, as much as they might love Nintendo.

This is a breaking story, and we will be updating this post as we learn more.

See Nintendo Switch 2 Livestream at Best Buy

Title: The First Reactions to the Live-Action How to Train Your Dragon Are Here
Description:
The crowds at CinemaCon in Las Vegas were treated to an early screening of Universal Pictures’ How to Train Your Dragon, and the resounding reaction from those in attendance is excitedly positive.

The feature from writer-director Dean DeBlois is a live-action adaptation of the DreamWorks animated films that DeBlois also oversaw. Mason Thames (The Black Phone) and Nico Parker (The Last of Us) star as Hiccup and Astrid alongside Gerard Butler, who reprises the role of Hiccup’s father, Stoick the Vast, from the original films.

The CinemaCon screening previewed the film before its June theatrical debut for film industry professionals, invited media, and content creators. io9’s Germain Lussier was in attendance and we’ll kick things off with his thoughts:

The live-action #HowToTrainYourDragon captures the magic of the original in almost every way. All the big moments are there, all the heart and excitement too. Wonderful performances all around. My only gripe is the new stuff, while good and subtle, never elevates things enough. pic.twitter.com/4ReJ9WQYE2 — Germain Lussier (@GermainLussier) April 2, 2025

And more:

#HowToTrainYourDragon is excellent!! It is by far one of the best live-action adaptations, but I still prefer the animated film. The casting is perfect, and the emotion is palpable. Thanks to its acting and character dynamics, I was emotionally engrossed, and I did fall in love… pic.twitter.com/wGvFPjhMj7 — Rosa Parra (@rosasreviews) April 2, 2025

#HowToTrainYourDragon was, simply, incredible. The flight scenes were awe-inspiring, that action was dynamic/riveting, and it retains all the heart and humor along the way. Wasn’t exactly sold on this live-action remake before, but I’m blown away. #CinemaCon https://t.co/78sN7t6FFT pic.twitter.com/85r1mW4rA0 — Jordan Maison @CinemaCon (@JordanMaison) April 2, 2025

#HowToTrainYourDragon is the best live-action adaptation film I’ve seen. Big fan of the original, and it was everything that I wanted to see- the score, the acting, and the VFX were PERFECT. Cried a few times. I’ve never loved a CGI creature more than Toothless. #CinemaCon pic.twitter.com/X8IgYvfoEu — Dorian Parks (@DorianParksnRec) April 2, 2025

Publié par @jasminepaigemoore View on Threads

How to Train Your Dragon does live action remakes of animated classics right. Dean DeBlois nigh perfectly adapted the original. It’s like watching a classic in a whole new experience. It exceeded all my expectations! #HowToTrainYourDragon #CinemaCon #CinemaCon2025 pic.twitter.com/XFIvowCyux — Jeffrey Harris (@Wheeljack83) April 2, 2025

Took the family to see a screening of the live action #HowToTrainYourDragon movie, coming out this June, they LOVED it, here with director @DeanDeBlois and Christian and Glen from Framestore #❤️🐉 #ToothlessForever #dragonsareREAL pic.twitter.com/tNiUQVMMGX — Cressida Cowell (@CressidaCowell) March 28, 2025

I was in a fight with #HowToTrainYourDragon in its first act. By the time Hiccup touches Toothless’ nose, I lost that fight. I couldn’t help but give myself completely to a story I love deeply, even while accepting its tendency to be safe. pic.twitter.com/sP2DLuIdPH — Ju Ju! (@Straw_Hat_Goofy) April 2, 2025

How To Train Your Dragon was INCREDIBLE. There are jaw dropping sequences that truly took my breath away. 2 scenes in particular had me in tears. Mason Thames truly embodies who Hiccup is and it was a sight to behold. This is the family film of the summer. #HowToTrainYourDragon pic.twitter.com/PGlmGBsZSe — Junior Felix (@JuniorFett) April 2, 2025

How to Train Your Dragon won’t overcome those who are staunchly against remaking animation as live-action, but ultimately, it’s a great story once more very well told. It didn’t reinvent anything yet unlike, say, Lion King 2019, it still has heart and I still cried. https://t.co/9ceL3wGSlz — Eric Goldman (@TheEricGoldman) April 2, 2025

Just saw the live-action How to Train Your Dragon and—wow.

An incredible experience that wears its heart on its sleeve. The care and love poured into adapting this beloved franchise is undeniable, and it shows in every frame. pic.twitter.com/j8leQ5QSRF — Benjamin Watts (@BennyWatts) April 2, 2025

Publié par @jenkz.p View on Threads

#HowToTrainYourDragon is one of the best live-action adaptations of an animated film ever! The characters and dragons were brought to life and there are so many magical, fantastic and emotional moments. I'm ready for another test drive! pic.twitter.com/BKbFbGrngX — John Nguyen (@JohnSpartan300) April 2, 2025

How To Train Your Dragon bucks the trend of live-action remakes being subpar. It beautifully takes on the original animated film but adds just enough to stand out from it. #CinemaCon #HowToTrainYourDragon pic.twitter.com/84pQXuPzJh — That Hashtag Show (Official) (@ThatHashtagShow) April 2, 2025

Pretty blown away by #HowToTrainYourDragon tbh. There’s this depth and heart and intensity that the live action brings, and some small perfect story tweaks that really make it soar. The score is incredible, the tears were flowing – it’s SO good. #CinemaCon pic.twitter.com/FW1gTRlulg — Erik Davis (@ErikDavis) April 2, 2025

I have only sort of interacted with the animated #HowToTrainYourDragon so seeing the live-action was a beautiful adventure. Toothless is a cat and I would die for him pic.twitter.com/JZ9EAuooWI — Rachel Leishman (@RachelLeishman) April 2, 2025
